result.execSummary:
The defendant Cruz Javier Guzman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Cruz Javier Guzman
Current: 2760 E ADAMS CT APT 8, Milwaukee, WI 53110 United States  (Effective: 07-28-2015)
Prior: 6070 S Robert Ave, Cudahy, WI 53110 United States

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.  

COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 30 DAYS, STRAIGHT TIME, in the House of Correction, to run concurrent to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees on or before 06-25-2016.  Failure to pay Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form

Defendant Cruz Javier Guzman in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Cruz Javier Guzman not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be reassigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45 in Room 515 of the Courthouse. Defendant NOT produced for plea & sentencing. Case adjourned of plea & sentencing to branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cruz Javier Guzman in court with attorney Francisco Araiza. Morgan Willz supervised by Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing at request of Defense Counsel. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Cruz Javier Guzman in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Cruz Javier Guzman in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.    All parties are advised effective August 3, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
